meanings.definition: In a natural state; not processed or refined.
meanings.sent1: The rawest honey comes straight from the beehive, untouched by any machines.
meanings.sent2: The rawest emotion she felt was pure joy when she saw her newborn baby for the first time.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cook dinner for the first time, but the rawest attempt ended up in a burnt mess.
meanings.sent4: Her rawest talent was painting, where she could express herself freely on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The rawest beauty of the untouched forest took his breath away.

meanings.definition: Lacking experience or sophistication; crude or unrefined.
meanings.sent1: His rawest attempt at public speaking left the audience feeling awkward and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The rawest recruits in the army struggled to keep up with the seasoned soldiers.
meanings.sent3: She made the rawest joke at the party, causing everyone to burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The rawest diamond in the rough turned out to be the most valuable gem of all.
meanings.sent5: His rawest dance moves were endearing, showing his genuine enthusiasm on the dance floor.
